name: m-a-p/COIG-CQIA
description: The COIG-CQIA dataset is a high-quality, open-source collection of instruction fine-tuning data specifically designed for the Chinese NLP community. It is constructed from a variety of sources on the Chinese internet, including Q&A and articles, and has undergone a rigorous process of deep cleaning, restructuring, and manual review to ensure its quality, diversity, and relevance. The dataset is inspired by studies like LIMA: Less Is More for Alignment, aiming to help large language models learn human-like interaction behavior with minimal data.
citeAs: @misc{bai2024coig,     title={COIG-CQIA: Quality is All You Need for Chinese Instruction Fine-tuning},      author={Bai, Yuelin and Du, Xinrun and Liang, Yiming and Jin, Yonggang and Liu, Ziqiang and Zhou, Junting and Zheng, Tianyu and Zhang, Xincheng and Ma, Nuo and Wang, Zekun and others},     year={2024},     eprint={2403.18058},     archivePrefix={arXiv},     primaryClass={cs.CL}   }
creator: Multimodal Art Projection
keywords: NLP, Chinese Instruction Fine-tuning, Question Answering
